metadata.synopsis: The players encounter a squad of Harpers at the Last Light Inn who're preparing to set out on a dangerous mission to ambush a drider and some cultists in the shadow-cursed lands. Lassandra, a Harper scout that the player may have helped previously, might be there.
metadata.how_to_trigger: After speaking with Jaheira, the Harpers should be in place outside the Inn, waiting for you. Speak to them to begin the quest.

57.speaker: Harper Branthos
57.text: You mean to reach Moonrise. And I've orders to help you.

34.speaker: Harper Branthos
34.text: The path to the Towers is drenched in blackness so deep, even a torch cannot quell it.

32.speaker: Harper Branthos
32.text: Yet the cultists have found a way to move freely. Whatever this method, you must claim it.

64.speaker: Harper Branthos
64.text: A cultist convoy crosses the land as we speak. I've readied an ambush. Say the word, and we fly.

41.speaker: Lae'zel
41.text: A Moonlantern - it must be. And we must take it. Githyanki perish in bloodbaths, not dreary curses.

59.speaker: Shadowheart
59.text: Sounds like a Moonlantern - that's just what we need.

13.speaker: Karlach
13.text: Gotta be a Moonlantern. Just what we need.

50.speaker: Astarion
50.text: A Moonlantern, surely? I would love to have one of those.

25.speaker: Wyll
25.text: A Moonlantern, I wager. There's no overstating the advantage we'll gain with that light.

17.speaker: Gale
17.text: If they move freely, they must have a Moonlantern. Let's have a little war with that convoy and claim the spoils.

5.speaker: Lae'zel
5.text: We must take this advantage. Githyanki perish in bloodbaths, not dreary curses.

22.speaker: Shadowheart
22.text: Sounds like just what we need to get to Moonrise.

2.speaker: Karlach
2.text: Fuck yes - let's do it! I want to crush something evil.

29.speaker: Player
29.text: Let's take on that convoy. You lead, I follow.

40.speaker: Harper Branthos
40.text: Splendid. I'll mark your map, should you lose the way.

33.speaker: Harper Lassandra
33.text: So glad to have you. Truly.

54.speaker: Harper Branthos
54.text: Harpers - with me. Stray no more than an arm's length from your course.

62.speaker: Player
62.text: Go on ahead. I'll catch up.

66.speaker: Harper Branthos
66.text: As you say. I'll mark your map with the rendezvous point.

31.speaker: Harper Branthos
31.text: Don't be long. Our window of chance will close all too quickly.

45.speaker: Player
45.text: Jaheira said Isobel had a way to keep me safe.

43.speaker: Player
43.text: Shouldn't Isobel's blessing keep me safe?

24.speaker: Harper Branthos
24.text: Isobel's blessing is a palliative, not a cure. Some shadows, even her magic can't counter.

35.speaker: Player
35.text: Wait here. I need time to prepare.

52.speaker: Harper Branthos
52.text: My feet are planted deep 'til you return.

65.speaker: Harper Branthos
65.text: But don't tarry. The greater the opportunity, the shorter its visit.

21.speaker: Player
21.text: You're too late - I've encountered the convoy, led by a drider.

4.speaker: Harper Branthos
4.text: What? Hideous beast! It is a miracle you're alive.

0.speaker: Player
0.text: Not just alive - victorious. I killed it.

3.speaker: Harper Branthos
3.text: Holy hells. Incredible, that it didn't tear off your every limb.

60.speaker: Harper Branthos
60.text: And their means of safe passage - do you have it?

42.speaker: Player
42.text: I wasn't able to retrieve it, I'm afraid. The way will be dark indeed.

48.speaker: Harper Branthos
48.text: Hells. Then our chance has passed.

37.speaker: Player
37.text: Forget the convoy. I can handle myself out there.

49.speaker: Harper Branthos
49.text: Is that it, then? I'm no stranger to indifference, True Soul.

8.speaker: Harper Branthos
8.text: Just as I'm no stranger to the scars it leaves behind.

10.speaker: Harper Branthos
10.text: But - there will be more chances. You'll make them. It's what you do.

30.speaker: Player
30.text: Yes, I've taken their light. I will be safe in its glow.

46.speaker: Harper Branthos
46.text: I'll be damned - you're something else.

38.speaker: Player
38.text: A magic lantern. It'll help. But it's only a tool, not a solution.

63.speaker: Harper Branthos
63.text: Go, then - Moonrise Towers awaits. But know this:

15.speaker: Harper Branthos
15.text: You don't just fight shadows. You fight what hides inside.

53.speaker: Player
53.text: Forget the convoy. I am your saviour here, not some magic lamp.

19.speaker: Harper Branthos
19.text: Mind the gap between confidence and arrogance, True Soul. That's where true danger lies.

20.speaker: Harper Branthos
20.text: Go on, then - take your lantern, or not. Moonrise is waiting.

51.speaker: Player
51.text: I stayed well out of its way. There was no chance of it spotting me.

23.speaker: Player
23.text: I only saw its trail. It was fresh.

44.speaker: Player
44.text: Not a miracle - I was simply careful. I saw its light in the distance.

58.speaker: Harper Branthos
58.text: Then it has already travelled to Moonrise.

47.speaker: Astarion
47.text: Sounds like an opportunity. And it would be nice to surprise the Absolute for once.

7.speaker: Wyll
7.text: I'm with the Harper, chief. We should take every advantage in reach.

28.speaker: Gale
28.text: If they move freely, they must have some kind of magic that protects them. I'm not averse to claiming that magic indeed.

61.speaker: Harper Branthos
61.text: Say the word, and we set the ambush in motion.
